intro: Oxypetalum malmei, commonly known as the Malme's oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
